item.title: Add custom files and directories in custom locations
item.description: Move2Kube allows custom template files to be added to any directory. This example illustrates this by adding a custom Helm chart. Start by creating an empty workspace directory named workspace and make it the current working directory. Asume all commands are executed within this directory. $ mkdir workspace && cd workspace Use the enterprise-app as input for this flow. $ curl https://move2kube.konveyor.io/scripts/download.sh | bash -s -- -d samples/enterprise-app/src -r move2kube-demos $ ls src README.

item.title: Parameterizing custom fields in Helm Chart, Kustomize, OC templates
item.description: This tutorial illustrates how to parameterize a custom field in the Helm chart generated by Move2Kube. Start by creating an empty workspace directory named workspace and make it the current working directory. Assume all commands are executed within this directory. $ mkdir workspace && cd workspace Use the enterprise-app as input for this flow. $ curl https://move2kube.konveyor.io/scripts/download.sh | bash -s -- -d samples/enterprise-app/src -r move2kube-demos $ ls src README.md config-utils customers docs frontend gateway orders Run Move2Kube without any customization.

item.title: Add custom annotations to Kubernetes YAMLs
item.description: Move2Kube generates Kubernetes YAMLs based on the needs of the application, but there might be situations that might require specific fields to be different in the output. This example illustrates how to add an annotation to the Ingress YAML specifying an ingress class. Create an empty workspace directory named workspace and make it the current working directory. Assume all commands are executed within this directory. $ mkdir workspace && cd workspace Use the enterprise-app as the input for this flow.
